description:
The has_finished_migration method in the compute API should use the instance UUID.

I'm getting the following stack trace from nova-api Postgres with the most recent nova trunk (bzr 1296) code:

(nova.api.openstack): TRACE: HINT:  No operator matches the given name and argument type(s). You might need to add explicit type casts.
(nova.api.openstack): TRACE:  'SELECT migrations.created_at AS migrations_created_at, migrations.updated_at AS migrations_updated_at, migrations.deleted_at AS migrations_deleted_at, migrations.deleted AS migrations_deleted, migrations.id AS migrations_id, migrations.source_compute AS migrations_source_compute, migrations.dest_compute AS migrations_dest_compute, migrations.dest_host AS migrations_dest_host, migrations.old_flavor_id AS migrations_old_flavor_id, migrations.new_flavor_id AS migrations_new_flavor_id, migrations.instance_uuid AS migrations_instance_uuid, migrations.status AS migrations_status \nFROM migrations \nWHERE migrations.instance_uuid = %(instance_uuid_1)s AND migrations.status = %(status_1)s \n LIMIT 1 OFFSET 0' {'instance_uuid_1': 2, 'status_1': 'finished'}
(nova.api.openstack): TRACE: 

---

Thanks to postgres for type checking this one for us!
title: compute API has_finished_migration should use uuid

comments.content:
The has_finished_migration method in the compute API should use the instance UUID.

I'm getting the following stack trace from nova-api Postgres with the most recent nova trunk (bzr 1296) code:

(nova.api.openstack): TRACE: HINT:  No operator matches the given name and argument type(s). You might need to add explicit type casts.
(nova.api.openstack): TRACE:  'SELECT migrations.created_at AS migrations_created_at, migrations.updated_at AS migrations_updated_at, migrations.deleted_at AS migrations_deleted_at, migrations.deleted AS migrations_deleted, migrations.id AS migrations_id, migrations.source_compute AS migrations_source_compute, migrations.dest_compute AS migrations_dest_compute, migrations.dest_host AS migrations_dest_host, migrations.old_flavor_id AS migrations_old_flavor_id, migrations.new_flavor_id AS migrations_new_flavor_id, migrations.instance_uuid AS migrations_instance_uuid, migrations.status AS migrations_status \nFROM migrations \nWHERE migrations.instance_uuid = %(instance_uuid_1)s AND migrations.status = %(status_1)s \n LIMIT 1 OFFSET 0' {'instance_uuid_1': 2, 'status_1': 'finished'}
(nova.api.openstack): TRACE:

Thanks to postgres for type checking this one for us!
